value: set
The large dragon is held in place breathing heavily.
Guh... Enough...
You've proven your strength. What do you want?
As we said-
What?
Speak Louder!
WE HAVE COME BECAUSE OF ME!
Hmm? What's this...
The huge dragon brought his head closer to the ground and observed Ember.
Ooh, why haven't you said so sooner.
Because of your senile deafness.
Quiet. You'll be worse than me in mere decades.
...So now you can hear.
You have a familiar scent.
What's your name, child?
I'm Ember. Nice to meet you.
Even though we've fought already.
I see... You are the child of Ezet.
Truly a wonder to meet someone like you.
Ezet? Is that the name of my mother?
Yes. You have no knowledge of your ancestry? A pity.
Ezet was one of our wyer. But it's from a time before we were facing today's crisis.
What crisis?
Hmm... I'll need time to explain.
We dragons possess souls unlike normal mortals. Andh these souls grant us sentience.
When a dragon dies, his soul leaves his body and finds its way to a new one.
Without a soul, we are but beasts. You've met many of those on your way here.
From some time ago something has changed.
Dead dragons have been reborn less and less. Somehow, their souls can't find a way back here.
No way.
I haven't seen anyone here for the last few years. I fear that we might be hunted.
But it feels like... You might have Ezet's soul inside of you.
Somehow she managed to conceal herself inside of you.
My mother inside of me? So I'm her?
No. It would be more accurate to say that she lays dormant, perhaps occasionally influencing your actions.
Then that note was likely her doing.
So that means... My mother is dead?
Yes and no, her body is likely dead, but her soul is within you for now.
I hope she will eventually be reborn as we once were.
Although I did not expect her to take a... Mortal partner.
At times like these I will not complain.
My name is Qothus.
I welcome you as one of my kin.
Before you continue with the family reunion, there's one thing we need to ask for.
Yes?
We are currently looking for someone...
blackscreentransition
Curious story, but my knowledge is not enough to help you here.
I don't know anything about that person or item you possess.
Well damn. At least I've defeated a dragon today. What do you think father would say?
Now that you say it, we actually did...
Well, Ember, take your time, we will be waiting around the corner.
Party leaves Ember alone with the Qothus.
I didn't expect this would turn out like this.
Threads of destiny are often chaotic in nature.
Your mate is strong, you've chosen wisely.
Wha-? Sir Arron is not my...
Or was it Ezet's influence, I wonder.
Um, could you tell me about my mother?
Oh, she was one nasty rascal.
And a fool unlike others.
Always got into fights with others. One time she even scorched Elder's nest cave.
Shame I won't see her again.
You were related?
We are all siblings in a sense.
Ah, so I can call you an Uncle Qothus then?
This is...
Please?
*sigh* Alright.
But what should I do now?
You look quite accustomed to mortals.
You should naturally stay with them now.
In truth, I don't know if we will even continue to exist for much longer.
I haven't seen or heard of anyone for a long time until you came.
So go, glide proudly and remember what you are.
Don't shy away from returning here if you need help.
I may look old, but a few more centuries are nothing for me.
Thanks, Uncle Qothus I'm glad we met.
Ember awkwardly hugged the big dragon.
